intro: Microchaeta lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf microchaeta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
